meanings.definition: The act of acknowledging a new landlord or owner of property.
meanings.sent1: The attornment of the tenant to the new landlord was completed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The attornment of the property to the new owner was legally documented.
meanings.sent3: The attornment of the house to the new landlord brought a sense of security to the tenant.
meanings.sent4: The attornment of the property to the new owner symbolized a fresh start for the family.
meanings.sent5: The attornment of the lease agreement made the transfer of ownership official.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring allegiance or loyalty to a new ruler or authority.
meanings.sent1: The attornment of the citizens to the new ruler was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent2: The attornment of loyalty to the new authority was a significant moment in history.
meanings.sent3: The attornment of allegiance to the new leader sparked debates among the people.
meanings.sent4: The attornment of loyalty to the new ruler was a turning point for the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The attornment of allegiance to the new authority reshaped the political landscape.
